The following reply has been suggested by the WarOfficeo The Dominions Office and the Ministry of Labouragree to it."This matter was very carefully considered inconnection with the Military Training Bill, 1939, when a full statement was made by my predecessor who made itclear that the people of Northern Ireland were anxiousto bear the same burdens and sacrifices as their fellowcitizens here, but that the decision did not rest withthe Government of Northern Ireland but with this Governmentand ParliamentsHis Majesty's Government do not intend to shirk their responsibilities in this or in any other matter, and I am,of course, always prepared to review any decision takeneither by myself or by my predecessors if it appears thatit would be in the interests of our war effort to do so".
